titleInfo.title: USA v. Barner et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that Defendant's motion to Provide Transportation and Subsistence is granted and; that the US Marshal shall provide noncustodial transportation for Defendant between Belleville, Kansas and Omaha, Nebraska in the form of round-trip mileage, and any authorized subsistence, not to exceed the authorized per diemas to defendant(s) Creighton Barner Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.(PCV, ) (cc to US Marshal)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Barner et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Creighton Barner. The Defendant plead guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is sentenced to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for 12 months and 1 day; and shall be given credit for time served. 3 years Supervised Release with special conditions; $100.00 Special Assessment; and $42,649.00 in Restitution to paid jointly and severally with co-defendant, Mary Barner. Counts II and IV of the Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the government as to this defendant only. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons on or before 9/11/07 as to defendant Creighton Barner. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (4 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:06-cr-00114; USA v. Barner et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Creighton Barner. The Defendant plead guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is sentenced to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for 12 months and 1 day; and shall be given credit for time served. 3 years Supervised Release with special conditions; $100.00 Special Assessment; and $42,649.00 in Restitution to paid jointly and severally with co-defendant, Mary Barner. Counts II and IV of the Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the government as to this defendant only. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons on or before 9/11/07 as to defendant Creighton Barner. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (4 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Barner et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Mary Barner. The defendant plead guilty to Count III of the Indictment and is sentenced to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for 12 months and 1 day; and shall be given credit for time served. 3 years Supervised Release with special conditions; $100.00 Special Assessment; and Restitution in the amount of $42,649.00 to be paid jointly and severally with co-defendant Creighton Barner. Counts I and II of the Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the government. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons on or after 9/11/07 as to this defendant only as to defendant Mary Barner. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (4 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:06-cr-00114; USA v. Barner et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Mary Barner. The defendant plead guilty to Count III of the Indictment and is sentenced to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for 12 months and 1 day; and shall be given credit for time served. 3 years Supervised Release with special conditions; $100.00 Special Assessment; and Restitution in the amount of $42,649.00 to be paid jointly and severally with co-defendant Creighton Barner. Counts I and II of the Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the government. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons on or after 9/11/07 as to this defendant only as to defendant Mary Barner. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (4 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Barner et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Pursuant to NECivR 79.1(f) or NECrimR 55.1(g), counsel for the government shall either 1) withdraw the following exhibits previously submitted in this matter within 15 calendar days of the date of this order, or 2) show cause why the exhibits should not be destroyed. If counsel fails to withdraw these exhibits as directed or to show cause why the exhibits should not be destroyed, the clerk's office is directed to destroy the listed exhibits without further notice to the parties or order from the court as to defendants Creighton Barner, Mary Barner. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (TJS)ORDER - Pursuant to NECivR 79.1(f) or NECrimR 55.1(g), counsel for the government shall either 1) withdraw the following exhibits previously submitted in this matter within 15 calendar days of the date of this order, or 2) show cause why the exhibits should not be destroyed.
